text: Michael F. Kane (born June 10, 1967 in Holyoke, Massachusetts) is an American politician who represented the 5th Hampden District in the Massachusetts House of Representatives and was a Holyoke City Councilor from 1996–2000.Massachusetts Legislature profile Kane resigned his seat on June 11, 2012 to take a job at Columbia Gas.http://www.masslive.com/news/index.ssf/2012/06 City Councilor Aaron Vega, a Democrat, won the election to succeed him during the general election on November 6, 2012.http://www.masslive.com/politics/index.ssf/2012/11/aaron_vega_linda_vacon_jerome.html ==References== Category:1967 births Category:Politicians from Holyoke, Massachusetts Category:American International College alumni Category:Massachusetts Democrats Category:Living people Category:Members of the Massachusetts House of Representatives Category:Holyoke Community College alumni
title: Michael F. Kane
